com.icrazyblaze.twitchmod.chat

Class ChatPicker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.icrazyblaze.twitchmod.chat.ChatPicker

  • public class ChatPicker
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for picking commands from chat and running them.

    • Method Detail

      • loadBlacklistFile

        public static void loadBlacklistFile()
        Loads the blacklist file, or creates the file if it doesn't already exist.

      • addToBlacklist

        public static void addToBlacklist(java.lang.String toAdd)
        Parameters:
        toAdd - The string to add to the blacklist file.

      • clearBlacklist

        public static void clearBlacklist()
        Clears the blacklist file.

      • checkChat

        public static void checkChat(java.lang.String message,
                             java.lang.String sender,
                             boolean forceCommands)
        Checks the command against the blacklist, unless force commands is enabled.
        Parameters:
        message - The chat message
        sender - The sender's name
        forceCommands - Should the command ignore the blacklist and run anyway?

      • pickRandomChat

        public static void pickRandomChat()
        Picks a random chat message, and checks if it is a command. If the chat message is a command, it will be run. Otherwise, a new message is picked.

      • registerCommand

        public static void registerCommand(java.lang.Runnable runnable,
                                   java.lang.String... keys)
        Adds a command to a list that ChatPicker checks. The registerCommand method takes two arguments: a runnable, and any number of command aliases. 
         
     registerCommand(() -> BotCommands.myCommand(), "mycommand", "mycommandalias");
        IDEA will swap the lambda for a method reference wherever possible.
        Parameters:
        runnable - The function linked to the command
        keys - Aliases for the command

      • doCommand

        public static boolean doCommand(java.lang.String message,
                                java.lang.String sender)
        Attempts to run a command.
        Parameters:
        message - The actual command, e.g. "!creeper"
        sender - The sender's name, which is used in some commands.
        Returns:
        If the command doesn't run, then this method returns false.

      • commandFailed

        public static void commandFailed()
